snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes Quora telling other people what you are reading, the hacker group Anonymous getting angry at a company that...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes Quora telling other people what you are reading, the hacker group Anonymous getting angry at a company that trademarked its logo and the chief executive of Flipboard quitting Twitter's board.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Trademarking 'Anonymous,' and Leaving Twitter
